***REMOVED*** General application strings --> Tap a card. Reading card… Do not move card History No trips found. Has this card been used? Loading… Supported Cards
No part of this card is freely readable without a key. You have no valid keys installed for it.\n\n If supported by SGCardReader, the card will work once keys are installed for it. These are generally different for each card. More info about acquiring and installing keys can be found in the documentation.\n\n If your card is not supported by SGCardReader, it is unlikely it will ever be, unless the key for it is deciphered.\n\n Please lobby the card issuer to allow open data access on issued cards. It is safe to permit open, read-only access to data with modern smartcard technology. Some agencies even provide open documentation about the data format!

Card partially read!
The card went out of range while reading.\n\n Some data was read, but it might not be enough to get useful data.\n\n Thick cases and metal can interfere with NFC operation. Failure could also indicate that the card or your device\'s NFC antenna is damaged.

***REMOVED*** These strings are used for content descriptions (accessibility), for modes of transport. Using them for custom pages on individual operators is discouraged (eg: Opal), as strings and translations should match the terminology of the operator (eg: light rail vs. tram). ***REMOVED***

***REMOVED*** Myki (Victoria, AU). These are deliberately separated strings in order to match the terminology of the agency. --> Convert times to current timezone By default, CEPAS Reader displays travel times in the timezone of the transit agency. If this option is enabled, we will convert travel times to your device\'s current timezone.
Expiry date
This card is completely blank as far as we can tell. It is formatted but without any data written to it. It still has a serial number by which it can be uniquely identified and linked to a database but card itself contains no other data.
